subcategories.title: EC1 Łódź - City of Culture
subcategories.content:
The first municipal power plant in Łódź consisting of two blocks: EC1 East launched in 1907 and EC1 West added in the interwar period. After the war, the Łódź Power Plant was transformed into a combined heat and power plant and thus served Łódź until the beginning of the 21st century. In 2008, the revitalization of the historic building located in the new center of Łódź began.
Currently, it houses the most modern planetarium in Poland, the National Center for Film Culture, the Center of Comics and Interactive Narrative created by the organizers of the International Comics and Games Festival as well as conference rooms and halls for the organization of events, including the largest Art Nouveau Hall of Machines (1360 sq m).
In January 2018, an interactive science and technique center was opened - the largest institution in terms of this type in the country. On almost 8.5 thousand sq m. The exhibition space in EC1- West stood three educational paths. The first of them concerns energy processing, the second development of knowledge and civilization, and the third allows you to explore the secrets of micro- and macro.

subcategories.title: Lithzmannstadt ghetto
subcategories.content:
Before World War II, the Jewish population constituted 1/3 of the inhabitants of Łódź. Some of them miraculously left the boat after the outbreak of the war, but for many who stayed, there were hard times. In February 1940, in the Old Town and Bałut, i.e. the poorest parts of Łódź, one of the largest ghettos in Europe was created, which from the beginning of its existence was a slave labor camp. It was produced here, among others Clothing and shoes for the Reich Army. Working force was needed, which is why the ghetto was one of the longest functioning. Its liquidation was carried out in the summer of 1944.
Many residents of the ghetto could not stand the closure and the inhuman conditions in which they lived - they died of cold, hunger and exhaustion, some were taken to the extermination camps in Chełmno nad Nerem and Oświęcim -Brzezinka. With over 200,000 Jews who went through the Łódź ghetto survived only 5-12,000 (the exact numbers are unknown). They are commemorated by the 60th anniversary of the liquidation of the Park Ghetto Park with a monument to Poles saving Jews and over 600 "memory trees" planted by those who survived Litzmannstadt Ghetto.

subcategories.title: Multicultural Łódź
subcategories.content:
In the nineteenth century, four nations created the industrial boat - Poles, Germans, Jews and Russians. The Germans and Jews were involved in craftsmanship and founded factories in which Poles came to Łódź as a promised land from small towns and villages. And all this happened in the Russian partition. Culture and languages ​​have penetrated each other, which traces remain to this day, among others in cuisine and language in Łódź.
Material souvenirs of multicultural boat are primarily temples and cemeteries. In Łódź there is one of the largest Jewish necropolises in Europe from the Mausoleum of the Poznań Israeli, which is probably the largest Jewish tombstone in the world. And the neo -Gothic chapel of Karol Scheibler at the Protestant part of the old cemetery, symbolizing the fame and wealth of the manufacturer, is considered one of the largest and most beautiful tombs in Europe.
The memory of a multicultural boat is cultivated especially during the Four Culture Festival organized by the Festival of Four Cultures, which is a continuation of the Four Culture Dialogue Festival. subcategories.title: Palm House
subcategories.content:
The Palm House of the Botanical Garden in Łódź is located in the Spring Park I and is an extremely attractive place for both small and large explorers of the world of the world. The exotic collection of plants is a living history of Łódź, initiated by Łódź manufacturers and tsarist officials. The first specimens of plants came from winter gardens. Due to their size, the plant did not fit in their homes and in home conservations and, as a last resort, went to the building of the first Łódź City Park.
The Palm House is divided into three parts: Mediterranean, tropical pavilion and a room with a rich collection of cacti. There is also a didactic garden reminiscent of an English garden, where double -plated ginkgo, sequoje, Metasekwoje, Dawidia Chinese as well as azaleas and rhododendrons. The building is planted over 4,300 plants and several animal species live there, including Turtles and carps loved by children. The oldest plants are over 150 -year -old palm trees and wonderful bananas, araucaries, bamboo and figs as well as orchids, bromelia, begonia, ferns and crotons.
The object ideally adapted for walks and rest. Alleys were created, interestingly arranged ponds, bridges and benches on which thirsty for silence and respite guests can relax. Cyclical natural exhibitions on a variety of topics are organized in the palm house and the adjacent garden. Exhibitions are accompanied by lectures and shows as well as fairs of plants and natural books. In addition, the time spent in the Palm House is made more attractive by outdoor events, during which, among others Various readings, workshops or handicraft exhibitions. The Palm House has permanently entered the city's landscape and is one of the favorite places of visiting Łódź and tourists throughout the year.

subcategories.title: Wooden chapels
subcategories.content:
The first of the wooden chapels dedicated to St. Antoni was built in 1676. This date is also considered the beginning of the Franciscans Foundation in the Lodz region. Originally, the chapel was probably a thanksgiving vote, and was issued on the initiative of the landowner, Samuel Żelewski. It is a small, cracked buckwheat building, with a shingle roof topped with a signature. Inside there are historic polychrome and altar, as well as the intake of spring water, which is not only known for its excellent taste, but also by many Łódź residents considered to have wonderful healing properties.
Chapel of St. Antoni was a central place of spiritual life of the surrounding population until 1681, when Pallavicini papal nuncio recognized Łagiewniki - according to legend, the place of revelation of Saint. Antoni - for the sanctuary. At that time, the decision to build a larger, wooden church and monastery was made, and a small chapel was moved to a nearby forest. Currently, the chapel is located about 1 kilometer from the original location, in a place called Hermitage. This is the oldest of six chapels and at the same time one of only two that survived to modern times.
The church and monastery have survived in their original block and decor. In the interior of the church, the Baroque altars attract attention, primarily the main altar dedicated to the patron of the Sanctuary, the Ambon, a rich organ prospectus and the chapel of Blessed Rafał Chyliński, two from the 18th century confessionals and the former crypt of Father Rafał in the southern transept of the church. In the church you can admire numerous examples of oil painting, epitaphs and commemorative plaques. St. Antoni is the oldest preserved church within the current administrative boundaries of Łódź.

In Łódź you will find many places that serve regional cuisine. Among these dishes, the most famous is the famous Zalewajka and the dumplings characteristic for our region served with plums served with fried cabbage.

Zalewajka - the most popular regional dish of Łódź
Decoration of Łódź tables, simple, cheap and delicious data, traditional soup with potatoes and sourdough - in a word: Zalewajka. Zalewajki, unlike similar soups, is that it is always made on rye sourdough. For two hundred years he has been a pearl in the crown of regional cuisine in Łódź and the basis for the food of the Lodz workers class - both during the industrial revolution and much later, in the times of People's Poland. Today he is experiencing his renaissance. Zalewajka deserves a special distinction in Łódź, which is why they take place here

Dumplings with plums served with meat and cabbage - a unique regional dish
Less known than Zalewajka, but an extremely interesting regional dish are dumplings with plums, which in the Łódź edition are served with fried, slightly sweet cabbage. This combination may seem quite extravagant, but traditional dumplings were served in a dry edition (at most slightly sweet). Dumplings with plums and fried cabbage were prepared by Łódź housewives in late summer and autumn, until winter. In the summer, the dumplings were accompanied by rather young fried cabbage, and in autumn and winter sauerkraut fried in lard, much less often with the addition of bacon.
Nowadays, you can learn the taste of this traditional regional boat dish primarily thanks to the Piwnica Łódź restaurant, which offers a permanent offer with plums and fried cabbage with slow stewed beef in the sauce.

It was these residents who liked the magic of cinemas, which was considered to be entertainment for lower social classes at their beginnings. In the post -war years, this popularity was powered by the film industry, which, as we know, developed dynamically in Łódź. Below are the cinemas that currently operate in Łódź. subcategories.title: Cinematography Museum in Łódź
subcategories.content:
The Museum of Cinematography in Łódź is the only museum of this kind in Poland that began its activity in 1976. At that time as a department of film and theater culture at the Museum of the History of the City of Łódź, and in 1984 it was separated as its branch. After ten years of operation, the museum moved to the new (today) headquarters in the former Palace of Karol Scheibler at pl. Victory 1.
It is not accidentally that such a museum was established in Łódź. Lodz through an excellent and only film school in Poland (PWSFTITV in Łódź) played the role of a film production center since the beginning of the development of cinematography.
In addition to organizing exhibitions or meetings, the museum has excellent museum collections. A substantial collection of nearly 76,000 exhibits is enlarged every year. The exhibits are collected in four basic departments: cinema history, film technique, poster and set design and animation.
The museum allows visitors to familiarize themselves with archival film apparatus, film life documents, material objects related to the creation and functioning of the art of the story, documentary, educational, animated, avant -garde, video and television, film programs, posters, set design, photos and souvenirs related to cinema people. The history of cinema in Łódź has not been forgotten, among others Cinema programs, souvenirs related to the stars of Polish cinematography or the Calendar of the Development of Silver Screen. One of the most important exhibits, however, is the original and fully functional photoplastikon, which played in the film "Vabank" (1981) by Juliusz Machulski.
The museum also has its own film archive and is the organizer of the Media Festival Man in a threat, whose content is contemporary Polish and foreign documentary films on social themes. The cinema cinema also operates in the museum.

subcategories.title: Monopolis
subcategories.content:
Water monopoly plants were established at the end of the 19th century at a distance from the city center. The construction of a monumental factory building began in 1897 according to the design of the excellent architect Franciszek Chełmiński. The vodka monopoly, consisting of several buildings with different functions, was permanently entered in the industrial history of Łódź - with its enormity dominated and almost matched the Emper of Łódź textile tycoons such as Karol Scheibler or Israel Poznań.
The history of the plants was not very turbulent for Łódź conditions. The monopoly was under the control of the Treasury or the magistrate almost all the time, clean vodka, spirit or denatured vodka were produced and poured. The plant's specialty was flavored vodkas - in the 1970s in Łódź there was the most modern laboratory in Poland for the production of flavored alcohols and five production lines. Brands associated with Polmos in Łódź - this name functioned during the Polish People's Republic, it is the president, delicatessen, Columbus and Regnum. Flavored and colorful vodkas were separate: club, stomach, pepper, forest and honey vodka.
The last bottle of alcohol was produced in 2007, it was also the beginning of changes taking place in the factory complex. The plants were purchased by a private investor - the company Virako - which transformed the former vodka monopoly into the office and cultural center named Monopolis. Currently, Monopolis combines various areas of activity in an unusual way. Guests will easily find restaurants with Italian, Japanese or Mediterranean cuisine or cafes with freshly baked bread, the best quality desserts and aromatic coffee. And for lovers of theater and art, Monopolis gives the opportunity to admire unique paintings, sculptures, photographs or posters in artgaleria and visit the Monopolis scene where Artsbinat takes care of artistic activities. Monopolis also invites families with children to the monospfer of creativity, where the youngest under the care of qualified staff can develop their passions and learn new things. In turn, you can learn more about the history of the place in a small museum of a water monopoly.
Monopolis in 2020 was awarded with two prestigious awards: Prime Property 2020 in the "architecture" category and called architectural Mipim Awards 2020 Oscars in the Mixed-Uste investment category.

The Retro Zone is a journey in the 1980s and 1990s, i.e. the beginning of the development of the video game industry in Poland. subcategories.title: Natural Museum of the University of Lodz
subcategories.content:
The roots of today's Natural Museum of the University of Lodz date back to 1930, when the institutions that exist in Łódź: Museum of Science and Arts and the Central Municipal Laboratory of Natural and Pedagogical Laboratory existing in Łódź were created. The organizer of the pre -war museum and its first director was Edward Powga, and the building of the former foodstuff was located in the Sienkiewicza Park in Łódź at Kilińskiego Street. This premises currently occupies the current Natural Museum of the University of Life Sciences.
Today's Nature Museum operates within the structures of the Faculty of Biology and Environmental Protection of the University of Lodz at the Department of Experimental Zoology and Evolutionary Biology. New exhibits and collections have been intensively obtained intensively throughout the years of the Museum. Some modern collections have a historical value and come from pre -war times. The collection includes specimens rarely displayed in Polish natural museums. The number of all museums is estimated at over 100,000, and the most numerous group are insects.
In 2019, the comprehensive expansion and modernization of the museum was completed, thanks to which an educational and cultural center was created, in which modern exhibitions popularizing natural sciences are presented. A significant increase in the exhibition and warehouse space (about 800 m2 in total) allowed the creation of new exhibitions and for the proper storage and maintenance of collections.

subcategories.title: State Higher Film, Television and Theater School Leon Schiller
subcategories.content:
State Higher Film, Television and Theater School Leon Schiller in Łódź was founded in 1948, although the academic education in the field of the film operated in Łódź since 1946. From the moment of its creation it was the fulfillment of filmmakers' dreams about the institution that would perform educational functions and at the same time was the center of film life in Poland. The university's mission is to reveal and develop students' talents and skills, raise in a sense of responsibility for the homeland, equipping with humanistic knowledge, education and preparation for artistic work in peeled fields of audiovisual arts, including film, television, theater, theater and acting.
Such excellent Polish artists as Roman Polański, Andrzej Wajda, Krzysztof Zanussi, Małgorzata Szumowska, Janusz Gajos, Cezary Pazura, Barbara Brylska and Krzysztof Kieślowski studied at school at school. Today's school is a whole campus consisting of both historic and modern spaces. The school rector is located in the Oskar Kon Palace at 61 Targowa Street. The famous stairs lead on the floor of school cinema, where students used to sit, discussing art and ideas for their own films. According to legend, it is one of the most famous stairs in the history of cinematography.

subcategories.title: UNESCO film city
subcategories.content:
As in America to Hollywood, in Poland the roads of all those who wanted to tie their future with the film led to Łódź. It was in the Film School in Łódź that the talents of the most outstanding creators of Polish and world cinema were polished, and their greatest works were created at the Film Factory, Educational Film Studies and the Small Film Studio SE-MA-For Film. The most outstanding actors worked here on the film plans, and world -class operators stood behind the cameras. The first cinema was also created in Polish in Łódź. Finally, a cinematography museum was established with its rich collection of film exhibits.
Today, the National Film Culture Center is being created in Łódź - a unique center for disseminating audiovisual culture, knowledge of film technologies and cinema history. The oldest film fund in Poland also operates in the city, and feature and documentary films, animations and advertising are made in dozens of larger and smaller film studies. Łódź has also become an outdoor for over 150 films and series, playing not only themselves but also various cities located around the world, such as Warsaw, Gdańsk, Munich and Istanbul.

Among them is Łódź, which obtained the title of the city of the UNESCO film. The efforts of Łódź for admission to the network of creative cities began in 2016. The coordination of works related to the preparation of the application was entrusted with the National Film Culture Center. The candidacy of Łódź was supported by the City Council, the Polish UNESCO Committee, film and artistic environments at home and abroad, as well as representatives of other creative cities. title: Lodz region
content: Discover fascinating tourist attractions in the vicinity of Łódź! This region abounds in picturesque landscapes that are perfect for hiking and bicycle trips. Green parks, historic buildings and charming towns full of local color are waiting for you here. It is an ideal place to relax for everyone - from lovers of history and culture, to enthusiasts of active spending in the open air. Regardless of whether you are planning a short trip or a longer stay, around Łódź have a lot to offer at any time of the year!

subcategories.title: Tomaszowska Okrąglica
subcategories.content:
Tomaszowska Okrąglica is an extremely attractive area located in the picturesque bends of the Pilica River. His resources include: Nagórzyckie caves, an open -air museum of the Pilica River and a nature reserve recognized under the name "Blue Sources". When planning a trip to this area, it is worth booking all day.
Noteworthy are the caves remaining after the excavations of the former sand mine with an area of ​​3720 m². During modernization in 2012, an underground tourist route was created here with a length of about 160 m, which is diversified by exhibits and replicas of tools referring to the functioning of the mine. The facility is made available only to a guide. The route walk lasts about 45 minutes at a temperature of about 10 ° C.
An interesting point of the trip is the open -air museum of the Pilica River - a unique museum object dedicated to the river and space, which it formed with its presence in the region. Among the objects worth seeing are moving models of mills with a collection of mill stones, an armored artillery tractor "Lufcik", a 100 -year -old working barr or folding kayak Jantar. The collection of collections is additionally made more attractive by souvenirs from the time of Tsar's Spała.
In the vicinity of the open -air museum there is the "Blue Sources" nature reserve - an extremely charming area for lovers of walks in the bosom of nature. The protection is protected here by karst wrapping surrounded by a flesh forest inhabited by numerous birds, and numerous information boards inform about the values. A walk, although attractive at any time of the year, is worth planning on a sunny day. The water then takes on a beautiful azure color.

subcategories.title: Termy Uniejów
subcategories.content:
Extremely popular all -year destination in the Łódź region. The thermal and swimming pool complex is located in a charming town on the banks of the Warta, which in 2012 received the status of a spa. He gained his popularity thanks to healing thermal brine flowing from wells at a depth of about 2 km. When going to the Termy Uniejów, great fun is guaranteed.
The facility has 2 zones: internal and external. Inside, brine pools with hydromassage devices, a children's zone, and a pirate ship in it are available to visitors. The outer part offers access to an attractive paddling zone for the youngest, brine pools and jacuzzi. There are several slides in the area, the highest of which reaches 58 m. For those who prefer resting outside the pool zone, the object invites you to the sauna and SPA and relaxation zones. For an additional fee you can use the Turkish, aromatic, aromatic, bani, ice pool or infrared cabin.
There is a water buffet and a restaurant for about 100 seats in the complex.

subcategories.title: Termy Poddębice
subcategories.content:
The watering and recreation center is a complex formed in natural geothermal waters at 72 ° C. It offers 7 swimming pool basins, including children's shower trays and a hot tub.  Visitors have two sauna zones with the cooling zone and the SPA zone. On site you can take advantage of a wide range of physiotherapeutic, care, relaxing massages, fitness classes and swimming or yoga. Before your visit, you should read the detailed offer on the website. The Term is located an ISON accommodation for a comfortable accommodation in air -conditioned rooms and a gastronomic part. The offer includes weekly and weekend stays.
The invaluable advantage of this place is its availability for the elderly and the disabled. The facility has modern solutions to meet the expectations of the most demanding guests. It is worth mentioning that the Termy Poddębice honors selected partner cards, and the details can be found on the website.

subcategories.title: Lowicz folklore
subcategories.content:
This is one of the best recognizable brands of the Łódź Voivodeship. The areas of the former Duchy of Łowicz derived and its beginnings date back to the first half of the 19th century. Visiting this part of the province, the colorful handicrafts of Łowicz draws attention. Once it was used to decorate cottages, today these motives appear wherever we want to color and cheer up space. The most popular are Łowicz cutouts: Kodry, Gwiozdy and Tasiems, for which plant motifs, flowers and roosters are used for decorating. The so -called "Spiders"- spatial, richly decorated forms suspended under the beams of the room. While the motifs of cutouts are used in the decoration of modern objects, "spiders" are only performed for special orders.
When choosing a meeting with the living Lowicz culture, it is worth visiting the People's Museum belonging to the Brzozów state in Sromów, where cutouts, spiders, and above all moving sculptures presenting scenes from the lives of the region's inhabitants are displayed. Religious sculpture and pottery, which are cultivating to this day, also includes the production traditions of the region. Folklore Łowicki is associated primarily with colorful striped costumes. It should be remembered that here also the known oberek was also formed and the musical traditions still remain alive.
If you want to taste the local folklore, it is worth going to Łowicz in Corpus Christi. On this day, the city is teeming with life. Handicraft stalls appear on the streets
and the music of local folk bands resounds. Tradition is intertwined with the present day creating a unique atmosphere.

subcategories.title: Indian Village Tatanka
subcategories.content: A charming and unique place on the map of the Łódź region. Created by a long -term member of the Polish Indian Movement, a village is a living history lesson about native inhabitants of North America. The advantage of the place is a tour with a guide who willingly shares his knowledge by telling about the culture and customs of the Indians. On the spot next to a dozen or so tipi, the Indian dugout is also made available for sightseeing, in which the museum is located. You can see many interesting exhibits, replicas of Indian handicrafts, costumes and, above you feel the atmosphere of old times, immersing yourself in the natural sounds of music from that era. A big attraction is the local mini zoo and the opportunity to participate in selected competitions. There is no shortage of attractions that will make children's dreams come true and feel like an Indian. The village can be visited individually and in groups.

subcategories.title: Zoo Borysew
subcategories.content:
A place that you do not need to advertise.  This is a private initiative, thanks to which over 500 animals from 5 continents found their home on 25 hectares. It has gained popularity due to rare white animals. These are lions, tigers, polar wolves and kangaroos.
Arrangement of space and catwalks allows you to move to the savanna and see animals in a environment similar to natural. The area can also be visited on a zookolej ride. Among the numerous attractions, it is worth going to demonstration feeding of selected species and visit the water world with the island where lemurs live. There is also a small farm where the youngest can experience close contact with goats or sheep. The facility has spherical tents with inflatables and a place to rest where you can buy something tasty or drink coffee.

subcategories.title: Skrzatów Valley
subcategories.content: A place where we can turn back time and enjoy Slavic climates. The guide to the valley is a Skrzatologist, who with commitment and professionalism draws the listener into the stories of Slavic traditions, culture and respect for nature, a walk at all ages. The sight of tiny gnomes with their daily activities and their scratch houses makes an impressive impression. The whole settlement is made only of natural elements, which is associated with the idea of ​​a pro -ecological attitude and teaches respect for the environment. The wide range of workshops, both handicrafts and nature, is adapted to the age of the client. The hosts of the Valley invite individual guests and organized groups. Before arrival, however, it is worth contacting the Valley's carers.

subcategories.title: Nieborów and Arkadia
subcategories.content:
The palace and garden team with a romantic garden is an interesting proposition of one -day trips around Łowicz. The assumption was created in the former noble lands and despite the intricate fate today it raises recognition and admiration of visitors. The best years of the residence fell at the times when the Radziwił family looked after the area. According to the trends in force at the time, a beautiful French -style park was created, where carefully selected plantings deserve attention. Two planes from the 17th century have survived in the park. Currently, the palace together with preserved exhibits is the Museum of the Interior of the Palace Residence from the 17th to the 19th century and is under the care of the National Museum in Warsaw.
Near the vision of Helena Radziwiłowa, a beautiful romantic park called Arkadia was also created.  Helena put huge energy in the arrangement of this place and took care of every detail of this place. Today we can admire here, among others antique ruins among the picturesque, old trees that delight at any time of the year,
The museum is the organizer of many events, concerts and interesting lectures, so before arrival, read the current proposal on the website of the facility.

subcategories.title: Power giants
subcategories.content:
A unique place in central Poland has been laid in the area of ​​unprecedented geological and natural values. PGE Gigans Power is an interactive exhibition referring to the subject to Zagłębie Górnicza in the Łódź Voivodeship. The exhibition is prepared to interest visitors at all ages in an attractive way. Knowledge in the field of natural sciences is transmitted in form, fun and experiments, thanks to which it easily goes to recipients. In 11Sal exhibition space, visitors can go back in time and find out how brown coal is created and what the process of generating electricity looks like.
The exhibition is a popular target of individual trips and organized groups that can combine the stay with workshops. On site, we can make purchases in a local shop and take advantage of the gastronomic offer. There is also a play corner for the youngest.

subcategories.title: Castle Oporów
subcategories.content:
Extremely charming, picturesque Gothic castle. The first mention of the building comes from the fourteenth century, when it was the seat of the Oporowski family. After World War II, he passed into the hands of the Treasury. Currently, its walls housed a court interior museum with unique furniture. The exhibition is enriched by works of art and utility items dating back to the 16th century. Unfortunately, only a few are associated with the history of the castle. Museum lessons in the field of knowledge about art are organized on site, but they are only available to organized groups.
An interesting fact is that the castle chambers were created for known productions, including "Mr. Car and Prague secrets", "Extradition" or "Crown of Kings". When visiting this place, it is worth walking with the alleys of the adjacent park, where both native and imported tree species grow, including ash, recognized as a natural monument.

subcategories.title: Rogowska Narrow Gauge Railway
subcategories.content: An interesting proposition for railway fans. Rogowska Railway Line is over 100 years old and is the longest active narrow -gauge railway in Poland. It is worth booking a ticket on a sunny weekend to fully enjoy the local attractions. The trip with the composition on the Rogów - Jeżów route will certainly enjoy the youngest participants.  For adults it will be like a journey in time: old warehouses, a conductor in his original uniform and a tiny brown cardboard ticket.  The return trip lasts an hour. There is half an hour break in Jeżów. There is a small gastronomic point where you can buy drinks or snacks. Those willing can also bake a sausage on the fire. After returning, it is worth looking around for railway sidings where there is part of the historic rolling stock.

subcategories.title: Arboretum in Rogów
subcategories.content:
A hail for nature lovers and rest in the bosom of nature. A beautiful forest park with an area of ​​about 50 ha, in which we can admire various species of trees and shrubs from around the world. It is worth going here in the spring, when azaleas and rhododendrons bloom and in autumn, when the greenery is bathed in red orange. A walk in narrow alleys then makes a huge impression.
After 2005, the building was modernized and significantly gained attractiveness. In the arboretum it is worth visiting, among others The garden of dying plants in the world and an alpinarium with a picturesque system of joints and peat bogs. Supporters of independent walks will certainly be pleased by the fact that numerous information and educational boards are arranged at the Arboretum. The facility can also be visited with a park employee or walking with an audio guide. The arboretum has its own plant sale point. Being a must -have point of the trip should be a visit to the forest and wood museum.

subcategories.title: The Kingdom of the Devil Boruta
subcategories.content:
The devil in the Lodz lands? Why not?! According to legend, Boruta lived in the Łęczyce lands and is associated with this area. His earthly house was the castle in Łęczyca and, according to local stories, he still guards the treasures hidden in the basement. The castle was built during the time of Casimir the Great and often hosted Polish monarchs. Despite the numerous attempts to save him after the invasion of the Swedes, he fell into ruin for many years. It is currently the seat of the museum. The collection presents primarily archaeological and ethnographic souvenirs obtained, among others from nearby excavations.  Here, too, the most popular Polish devil has its exhibition. It presents several hundred exhibits with nearly 200 Boruta sculptures in his various incarnations.
It is worth visiting the castle in the summer during the International Knight's Tournament. Knight's brotherhoods from Poland and Europe come here to present their skills during knightly fighting. Workshops and shows referring to medieval traditions are organized for visitors and the whole event is adorned with stalls
and stands of nearby creators.

subcategories.title: Raspberry stronghold
subcategories.content: The building is located on Zgierz Malinka, which has recently undergone a huge metamorphosis. Malinowy stronghold is a place for families with children, but also on organized groups. The space is divided into zones. Each of them is a different adventure. The journey runs, among others Through the land of Harry Potter, Avatar or the Book of the Jungle. The property is filled with an interesting range of games and games that will certainly interest younger generations. For those who are tired of local attractions, relaxation zones are prepared, including on hammocks. The raspberry stronghold also offers stays for groups organized under which an interesting workshop offer is available. Before arrival, it is worth reviewing the offer on the website.

subcategories.title: Dobronianka - mini zoo
subcategories.content:
A popular seat near Łódź, attracting many visitors on sunny days.  Dobronianka's offer is directed to every age group, but the youngest have the most fun here.  There is a mini zoo in the resort and nearly 50 species of animals. An attraction is certainly the possibility of treating animals purchased earlier with food and participation in feeding shows. Those willing can go for a walk with alpacas or a ride on a pony. An attractive playground, a blower zone is available on site, and for willing fun with animators and a foam bath.
As part of less exhausting attractions, water bikes are available, from which you can admire water birds, but this is an additional paid attraction, for which reservations should be made by buying a ticket at the entrance.
The facility is available gastronomy zones with a bar bar and cafe, and for amateurs of rest in the bosom of nature there are space on sunbeds and two beaches. It is also worth visiting Dobronianka after the season. In winter, a light park is waiting for visitors and the pumpkin farm is opened in autumn.

subcategories.title: Spycimierz
subcategories.content:
Only two kilometers from Uniejów in Spycimierz there is a cultural and educational center, which aims to promote local history and cultural heritage, which is the tradition of laying floral rugs on the Corpus Christi procession, entered in 2021 on the list of UNESCO intangible heritage.
Three permanent exhibitions are waiting for you in the Spycierm center:
A room dedicated to floral traditions and the Corpus Christi procession
intangible heritage hall dedicated to Polish traditions
archaeological room

subcategories.title: Subcourse
subcategories.content:
Hotel Podklaszorze is one of those places that will charm. Meet one of the best preserved Cistercians in Europe, picturesquely located in the very center of Poland in Sulejów.
The first monks lived here in 1176, the monastery church is one of the most valuable Romanesque monuments in Poland.
Among the guests of the abbey, it is worth distinguishing Władysław Jagiełło, who visited Sulejów in 1410 on the way to the battle with the Teutonic Knights. According to the application, the damage to one of the columns at the entrance door to the church in the Cistercian monastery, is the effect of sharpening the swords by the king and his knights.
It is here that the present is connected with the past.
Here you will soothe the soul and body in the first spa monastery in Poland, and the Honey and Wine and Craft Brewery restaurant will charm your taste buds.
It is an object that has become an inspiration for film directors such as "Janek", "Mr. Wołodyjowski", "Private Investigation" and "Marked". It was here that photos for the most famous productions were made.
Spend the night in historic walls, where every corner tells the story or take advantage of many attractions without accommodation, i.e. the Wellness Zone - swimming pool, jacuzzi, sauna, spa, tennis court, kayaking or bicycle rental.

subcategories.title: Centrum Pier in Smardzewice
subcategories.content:
Only 60 km from Łódź, surrounded by picturesque landscapes and calm water of the Sulejów Lagoon, there is a unique place - the center of the Molo. This Łódź Recreation and Business Center offers not only relaxation and beautiful views, but also full facilities for the organization of meetings and occasional events.
Centrum Molo is a modern facility with 100 comfortable rooms, spacious conference rooms, a private beach with water equipment rental and an elegant restaurant, from which there is a view of the charming lagoon. The biggest attraction is the longest inland pier in Europe, which attracts walkers and photography lovers - ideal for romantic walks and unforgettable photo sessions.
The center is a dream place for both tourists looking for rest and for people planning unique events, such as weddings, conferences and family meetings. The proximity of nature and a wide range of attractions make the Molo center the perfect place for every occasion.
We invite you to visit our unique center, where nature and relaxation meet with modern comfort!

subcategories.title: Cathedral Basilica in Łowicz
subcategories.content:

- The most important monument of this city - hides treasures created and collected for centuries. In this important center of political and religious life from the fourteenth century, the Gniezno archbishops resided. They built a beautiful temples - the most important sacred object in Mazovia. Not only did they care about her, but they were constantly expanding and embellished, they rebuilt if necessary. The greatest worked for the primate
